snippet: The raid at the naval base in Cuba followed weeks of tensions over a growing hunger strike that detainees’ lawyers say was provoked by a search of Korans in February.
abstract: Military officials describe chaotic conditions at Guantanamo Bay Naval Base in weeks leading up to raid by guards to lock down prison; say that detainees were breaking rules with impunity, blocking cameras and windows, shouting at guards and splashing them with urine, as well as refusing to go into their cells and freely roaming.
lead_paragraph: The raid at the naval base in Cuba followed weeks of tensions over a growing hunger strike that detainees’ lawyers say was provoked by a search of Korans in February.

headline.seo: Officials Describe Chaos Before Guantánamo Raid
headline.main: Officials Describe Chaos at Guantánamo in Weeks Before Raid on Prison
headline.print_headline: Officials Describe Chaos at Guantánamo In Weeks That Preceded Raid on Prison
